title: There wouldn't be a regional 'gene drain' if more career opportunities were available in the North
text:
How can you tell that a person is from Yorkshire? Don’t worry, they’ll tell you…

We Yorkshire folk are what I like to call the Americans of England. We’re loud (only to you), direct and extremely proud of our home county. So why, many people ask me, did you move to London?

As a new study from the journal Nature Human Behaviour claims that Britain’s traditional industrial regions are experiencing a ‘gene drain’, of the healthiest and most academically intelligent people, I believe my answer is the same as most North to South defectors. It’s not because London is the only place worth living in, but because it’s where most of the big opportunities are.
